question: Question_01_(a)
statement:
Multiple Choice Question: Select \textbf{ONE} correct answer \emph{(i)},
\emph{(ii)}, \emph{(iii)}, \emph{(iv)}, or \emph{(v)}.

\textbf{(a)} The value of the integral

\begin{align*}\int_0^1 e^{(x+e^x)}\,dx\end{align*} is

\begin{description}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item[]
\emph{(i)} ~ $\displaystyle {} \frac{e^{(x+e^x+1)}}{(x+e^x+1)}$

\emph{(ii)} ~ $\displaystyle {} e^e-e$

\emph{(iii)} ~ $\displaystyle {} e^e+e$

\emph{(iv)} ~ $\displaystyle {} e^{e+1}$

\emph{(v)} ~ $\displaystyle {} (1-e)e$
\end{description}
sols:
Rewrite the integral as

$\int_{0}^{1} e^{(x+e^{x})}dx=\int_{0}^{1} e^{x}e^{e^{x}}dx.$

Let $u=e^{x}$. Then $du=e^{x}dx$, and our new endpoints of integration
are

$e^{1}=e \qquad\text{ and }\qquad e^{0}=1.$

Thus, our integral becomes

$\int_{1}^{e} e^{u}du=e^{u}\mid _{1}^{e}=e^e-e.$

Therefore, the correct answer is (ii).
hints:
Rewrite the integral as
$\int_{0}^{1} e^{(x+e^{x})}dx=\int_{0}^{1} e^{x}e^{e^{x}}dx.$
